intro: Brittonrosea obvallata, commonly known as the broadleaf brittonrose, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses, strawberries, and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
